definition: high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
Guan Hanqing (c. 1235-c. 1300), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧 tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan dramatists 元曲四大家
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
Xu Zhenqing (1479-1511), Ming writer, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
Minister of imperial stud, originally charged with horse breeding/same as 太僕寺卿|太仆寺卿[Tai4 pu2 si4 qing1]
Minister of imperial stud, originally charged with horse breeding

sentences.english: Na received support from another prominent female politician, Park Geun-hye.
sentences.chinese: 羅卿瑗得到了另外一位傑出的女政治家朴槿惠的支持。

sentences.english: Duke Huan appointed Guan Zhong the chief minister, and yet the state of Qi was not peaceful and orderly.
sentences.chinese: 桓公任命管仲作上卿，可是齊國還不太平。

sentences.english: He(Reagan) sent Secretary of State Shultz to Capitol Hill in an effort to shore up wavering Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 卿舒爾茲到國會山莊去給意志動搖的共和黨議員打氣。

sentences.english: Nor thou nor  I could control it.
sentences.chinese: 卿與在下均無法控制之。

sentences.english: Look at these birds, do you know they fall in love with each other at first sight.
sentences.chinese: 你看那鴻雁飛過聲聲鳴，卿可知此鳥乃是恩愛禽。

sentences.english: What I want to stress is that each of us should listen to others.
sentences.chinese: 我想強調的是我們每個人都應該更多的卿聽它人。

sentences.english: Attend to long the Qing is expecting and greeted Saturday in the strain.
sentences.chinese: 顧長卿在期待和緊張中迎來了星期六。

sentences.english: "Should I know?"Attending to long Qing is very humiliated.
sentences.chinese: “我應該知道嗎？”顧長卿很不好意思。

definition: I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
Minister of War (official title in pre-Han Chinese states)/two-character surname Sima
to give in to/to be swayed by (personal considerations etc)/Taiwan pr. [xun2]/to follow/to expose publicly/variant of 侚[xun4]/variant of 殉[xun4]
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
old place name (in modern Linyi county 臨猗縣|临猗县, Shanxi)/two-character surname Linghu
